{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:01:13.159

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:01:19.159
    | text      = Still going? Have you figured out breading yet?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:01:21.159
    | text      = Easiest fucking thing in the world.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:01:23.159
    | text      = Yes it is.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:01:25.159
    | text      = A world has opened up in front of me that I should.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:01:29.159
    | text      = This is something that most people probably experience at 20, 19, maybe right when they move out.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:01:33.159
    | text      = Sure. Maybe when they still live with their parents.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:01:35.159
    | text      = It can happen.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:01:37.159
    | text      = I did not have those milestones.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:01:39.159
    | text      = And it's really fascinating to me.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:01:41.159
    | text      = It's very exciting in some ways.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:01:45.159
    | text      = Last night for dinner, I made some chicken and rice, chicken breasts.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:01:49.159
    | text      = It was fine. It was marinated a bit. Just with some lemon pepper and whatever.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:01:55.159
    | text      = Pretty basic, simple thing.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:01:57.159
    | text      = So today for lunch, I tried to kick it up a little bit more.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:02:01.159
    | text      = And I left it overnight last night in a bag with some soy sauce, chopped up garlic, and jalapeno.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:02:08.159
    | text      = And it was better.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:02:10.159
    | text      = But what I'm realizing is there's a whole world of marinades that I'm very excited to tinker with and explore.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:02:16.159
    | text      = And I think my bright spots for the foreseeable future might end up with me cooking some stuff.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:02:22.159
    | text      = Also in a couple days I plan to make that lasagna finally.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:02:25.159
    | text      = Now that I have this boost of enthusiasm and feeling of a can-do spirit from cooking a chicken breast.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:02:30.159
    | text      = I like it. I like it.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:02:32.159
    | text      = The problem was that for so long I thought, like I mentioned, that the only way you can really cook a chicken breast is in a pan on top of the stove.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:02:39.159
    | text      = And I would always burn them.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:02:41.159
    | text      = And so I got to the point where I was like, I can't do this.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:02:43.159
    | text      = It's for someone else.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:02:45.159
    | text      = And more people do that.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:02:47.159
    | text      = But I love a roasted chicken breast.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:02:49.159
    | text      = Sure, sure, sure.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:02:51.159
    | text      = So now I know that I can do this and I'm very excited and my life has changed.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:02:53.159
    | text      = Let me tell you something.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:02:55.159
    | text      = Wait until you figure out that you can sear it on both sides in the pan to get a nice little crust and then bake it after that.

{{TranscriptBlock

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:03:05.159

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:03:07.159

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:37:32.679
    | text      = We're going to talk about this way more than I want.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:37:35.719
    | text      = Okay, alright.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:37:36.719
    | text      = So, Alex, when he comes back from break, he does get into this more, and he starts talking
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:37:41.079
    | text      = about some of the actual press that he got because of this, like an article in Forbes.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:37:47.840
    | text      = Please, Forbes, please don't eat your neighbor.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:37:50.400
    | text      = Why?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:37:51.400
    | text      = What Alex Jones said is so dangerous, they go on to say, he is commanding the people
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:37:56.360
    | text      = in Michigan who stormed the Capitol, they may start eating people.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:01.320
    | text      = You talk about satire, but they're writing this as serious.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:05.059
    | text      = So that Forbes article does not say that Alex is telling protesters they should eat people.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:09.840
    | text      = The thesis could probably be summed up in this paragraph from the article.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:13.079
    | text      = Quote, the real danger, however, probably isn't to Jones' neighbors, but to all of us
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:17.519
    | text      = who might suffer the consequences from the actions of Jones who take his words literally.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:23.719
    | text      = While millions of Americans have good reason to be concerned about their economic well-being,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:27.820
    | text      = Jones is tapping into the fear of his listeners and suggesting that violence might be necessary
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:32.199
    | text      = for self-survival.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:33.880
    | text      = We're living in days when openly armed protesters are storming legislatures, so it's not a far
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:38.940
    | text      = leap to believe that people listening to Jones' extreme exhortations might be further provoked
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:43.440
    | text      = towards fear and violence.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:45.440
    | text      = Sometimes they might not see their neighbors as meals, but they might increasingly see
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:48.559
    | text      = them as adversaries in a world of accelerating scarcity.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:52.280
    | text      = The point of this article is that in times of crisis, it's crucial that we recognize
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:55.619
    | text      = our interdependence and that we see each other as being in this together.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:00.159
    | text      = Rants about eating your neighbors to feed your children is the sort of thing that's
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:02.840
    | text      = based on the opposite mentality, where you view everyone as on their own and that you
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:06.760
    | text      = are at best a commodity I can use and at worst a threat to myself and my loved ones.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:12.519
    | text      = The author of the article is really clear about this, and even defends Alex's right
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:15.519
    | text      = to say all the dumb and dangerous shit that he does.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:18.119
    | text      = Quote, although Jones' free speech should, by necessity, be constitutionally protected,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:22.800
    | text      = his dangerous messages of distrust and division need to be combated with even louder appeals
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:28.340
    | text      = for solidarity and common cause.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:31.679
    | text      = When Alex does these publicity stunts, a big downside to responding is that your response
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:37.460
    | text      = will be turned into a straw man that he will use to further radicalize his audience against
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:41.719
    | text      = any non-infowars sources of information.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:44.440
    | text      = I think this Forbes piece makes a great point, and I think it's an important thing to remember,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:48.639
    | text      = that it's crucial to look at people around you as collaborators, not competitors or food.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:53.000
    | text      = But ultimately, making that point in response to Alex's rant is probably counterproductive.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:58.559
    | text      = So like I said, that's what's going to happen.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:01.920
    | text      = Alex is going to lie about coverage of his stuff in order to fit it into the mold that
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:05.719
    | text      = he has in order to further insulate his audience.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:09.000
    | text      = And gaslight people who are coming to check him out based on that.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:15.639
    | text      = So Alex keeps talking about a modest proposal, and he said it's one of his favorite essays.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:20.159
    | text      = I'm not sure he's read it.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:21.800
    | text      = Now let's get into it.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:22.800
    | text      = A modest proposal from 1730 was Jonathan Swift, an Anglo-slash-Irish cleric, who was so sick
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:32.159
    | text      = of watching people starve to death by the thousands, and the English government saying,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:36.559
    | text      = oh, it doesn't matter, keep your taxes high, he said, well, then let's just tell them to
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:39.639
    | text      = â€"
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:40.639
    | text      = Keep their taxes high?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:41.639
    | text      = Tell them to us, and we'll eat them.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:43.300
    | text      = He describes how to fatten them up, how to butcher them, and it's the most famous piece
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:49.219
    | text      = of satire out there.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:50.980
    | text      = So real quick, a modest proposal is from 1729, not 1730.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:54.980
    | text      = Small difference, but it's one of the indications that Alex probably has no idea about what
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:58.079
    | text      = he's talking about.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:59.559
    | text      = It seems from Alex's telling of the story that he thinks a modest proposal had something
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:02.820
    | text      = to do with taxes being too high, which is not considered to be a mainstream reading
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:06.440
    | text      = of the text.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:07.440
    | text      = But it does make sense, considering that he probably only knows about the pamphlet from
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:10.440
    | text      = reading about it in some JBS John Birch Society book.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:13.280
    | text      = Yeah, yeah, yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:14.280
    | text      = I mean, like, he's talking about beggars and, like, destitute poor.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:19.000
    | text      = I don't think taxes were the â€"
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:20.719
    | text      = The ones who don't worry too much about taxes.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:22.639
    | text      = I don't think they're a primary concern.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:24.920
    | text      = So one of the main issues about reading a modest proposal from the academic standpoint
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:28.760
    | text      = is determining if Swift himself is the speaker in the text, or if it's a disconnected persona
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:33.719
    | text      = he's created for the pamphlet.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:36.079
    | text      = Elizabeth Hedrick explores this question in her piece for the journal Studies and Philology
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:39.900
    | text      = from Fall 2017, which gets into why this is a relevant question.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:44.719
    | text      = The suggestion of eating the poor relies on irony to be satire, but if it's understood
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:49.159
    | text      = that Swift himself is the one making this proposal, there's a problem with the irony,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:54.920
    | text      = namely that Swift is well-documented as absolutely hating the Irish poor.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:59.039
    | text      = His writings and sermons have been shown to include, quote,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:42:01.480
    | text      = "...angrily blaming the distresses of the Irish poor on their moral failings."
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:42:06.280
    | text      = You can easily see how the â€" if this is the person making the modest proposal, things
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:42:10.820
    | text      = get a bit murky, and thus the more widely accepted views of the character speaking in
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:42:15.159
    | text      = the pamphlet is not the author's voice, but fully detached from Jonathan Swift himself.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:42:21.400
    | text      = Hedrick argues that the way to bridge these two personae is to consider Swift's other
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:42:25.840
    | text      = writings, including particularly his non-satire pieces, to gain a better understanding of
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:42:30.960
    | text      = exactly what the target of a modest proposal's satire was.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:42:35.199
    | text      = Though admittedly there are a lot of barbs going in many directions, taken in the context
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:42:39.300
    | text      = of his body of work, Hedrick argues that the main thing being attacked in a modest proposal
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:42:43.380
    | text      = is societal politeness, and the Whig assumption, quote,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:42:47.320
    | text      = "...that good manners were in a sense transparent rather than performative, a reliable sign
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:42:52.480
    | text      = of one's own innate goodness rather than a pleasing front for malice or aggression."
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:42:57.699
    | text      = This was a view that Swift, quote,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:42:59.860
    | text      = "...found ethically simple-minded and politically dishonest."
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:43:04.079
    | text      = The narrator of the proposal is perfectly polite, in juxtaposition with the barbaric
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:43:08.039
    | text      = suggestion he's making, seeing himself as the savior of the country for proposing a
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:43:12.340
    | text      = solution that would deal with the problem of poverty.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:43:15.179
    | text      = This was mirroring the equally stupid but politely delivered suggestions that polite
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:43:19.139
    | text      = people were making at the time, and if you consider who Jonathan Swift was and what he
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:43:23.639
    | text      = believed, it's pretty clear that this is the largest part of what he was satirizing.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:43:28.440
    | text      = So essentially, he's talking almost about the difference between Obama and Trump bombing
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:43:35.980
    | text      = people.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:43:37.780
    | text      = Obama is putting a very calm and polite face on the atrocities that he's committing and
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:43:43.440
    | text      = Trump is a barbaric monster.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:43:45.059
    | text      = He's satirizing the political position that that is a relevant difference, that the polite
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:43:54.360
    | text      = face is more important than the action itself, to an extent, and that a lot of the things
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:44:01.219
    | text      = that had been suggested to help with the problem of poverty were awful, unviable, not working
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:44:09.860
    | text      = solutions delivered politely for the sake of putting a mask on your own nonsense.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:44:18.440
    | text      = And he sure as shit did not care about the poor.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:44:20.519
    | text      = That was not his motivation.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:44:22.159
    | text      = He wrote screeds against them, including 1737's quote, a proposal for giving badges to the
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:44:28.300
    | text      = beggars in all the parishes of Dublin.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:44:30.940
    | text      = That piece was very much not satire, and it includes this description of the impoverished.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:44:35.440
    | text      = Quote, they are too lazy to work, they are not afraid to steal nor ashamed to beg, and
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:44:40.019
    | text      = yet are too proud to be seen with a badge, as many of them have confessed to me.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:44:44.320
    | text      = For several years past, I have not disposed of one single farthing to a street beggar,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:44:48.300
    | text      = nor intend to do so until I see better regulation, and I have endeavored to persuade all my brother
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:44:52.980
    | text      = walkers to follow my example, which most of them assure me they do.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:44:56.539
    | text      = For, if beggary be not able to beat out pride, it cannot deserve charity.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:02.059
    | text      = Swift did not care about the well-being of the poor.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:04.239
    | text      = He was offended by the false-wig politeness with which solutions to the problem of poverty
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:09.800
    | text      = were suggested.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:11.420
    | text      = Ultimately, that could have the effect of pushing for actual solutions that could help
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:15.579
    | text      = the poor, but that doesn't seem to be Swift's primary concern.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:19.260
    | text      = So how does this relate to Alex and his rant about eating his neighbors?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:23.699
    | text      = Simply put, it doesn't, because nothing Alex did had a point.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:27.019
    | text      = He's trying to claim that he was making a modest proposal about eating his neighbors
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:30.460
    | text      = to draw attention to the fact that there are people in the developing world starving, but
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:34.059
    | text      = that is completely absent from his actual rant.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:36.980
    | text      = He was just talking about being willing to eat his neighbors so that his children don't
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:40.699
    | text      = starve.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:41.699
    | text      = If there's any rhetorical connection to people starving in the developing world, the best
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:45.460
    | text      = Alex could possibly claim is that his words are a condemnation of the people who are parents
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:50.780
    | text      = of starving children in those countries who don't kill their neighbors to feed their children,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:55.420
    | text      = but that doesn't seem like the point he was trying to make, but it would track, kind of.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:59.300
    | text      = That is a fair...
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:00.659
    | text      = I could read it that way, yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:02.539
    | text      = No, no, no.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:03.539
    | text      = You couldn't.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:04.539
    | text      = No.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:05.539
    | text      = No, no, no.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:06.539
    | text      = I think I will.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:07.539
    | text      = I think I have.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:08.539
    | text      = You're welcome to.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:09.539
    | text      = You know what?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:10.539
    | text      = Actually, you've convinced me, Dan.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:11.539
    | text      = That was a brilliant piece of satire on Alex's part.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:12.539
    | text      = I don't think that that's...
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:13.539
    | text      = I do think that people in countries should eat their neighbors.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:16.519
    | text      = I think that that's the best he could do.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:19.219
    | text      = If you take the position that Swift was really attacking the genteel politeness that was
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:23.179
    | text      = just the pleasing facade that hid people's real cruelty, would it be possible to connect
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:27.059
    | text      = that with Alex's rant?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:28.739
    | text      = I still think not.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:30.559
    | text      = If he were covering the people starving in the developing world and suggested we eat
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:34.420
    | text      = them, then the connection would be really clear.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:36.940
    | text      = But it doesn't track that yelling about eating your neighbors to feed your child is somehow
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:41.019
    | text      = a suggestion that lampoons the politeness of people who offer suggestions of how to
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:45.139
    | text      = help people in the developing world, but don't actually care.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:48.699
    | text      = I've really tried to find an angle where it could reasonably be argued that Alex's rant
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:52.960
    | text      = qualified as some kind of purposeful act of irony or satire, and everything I can come
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:57.380
    | text      = up with fails to satisfy the basic qualifications.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:47:01.059
    | text      = Also, let's not forget that Alex, you know, he talks about how everyone becomes a cannibal
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
